definition[0]: to make someone or something else seem less important
example[0]: Her interest in politics began to overshadow her desire to be a poet.
example[1]: The achievement of the men’s team was overshadowed by the continuing success of the women’s team.
definition[1]: to make an occasion or period of time less enjoyable by making people feel sad or worried
example[2]: The threat of war overshadowed the summer of 1939.
definition[2]: if a tall building, mountain etc overshadows a place, it is very close to it and much taller than it
example[3]: a dark valley overshadowed by towering peaks
